data.title: Make launch-dedicated scripts consistent between platforms
data.body:
Updates our launch-dedicated scripts to be consistent, and updates the windows script to properly use `OpenRA.Server.exe`.

I removed `Map` from both scripts. It only seems useful when your server disables resource center sync and has a limited map pool.

data.title: Multiple maps have bogus InitialSmudge definitions

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
In TD this includes nod07b, nod07c, nod08a, nod08b.  I haven't checked RA but I expect any newish missions there will also be wrong.

I expect the legacy importer is generating incorrect data, and because the rule upgrader is completely broken for map rules (!!!) nobody has spotted them.

data.title: Updated to Mono 4.4
data.body: See http://www.mono-project.com/docs/about-mono/releases/4.4.0/

data.title: Fix disabled AA gun continuing to track targets
data.body: Fixes #11446

data.title: Down powered AA guns still track aircraft
data.body: ![downaa](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/15991783/745bb144-30bd-11e6-8cb7-904f1c8a6a0e.gif)

data.title: Emp support power take 2
data.body: Successor of #11108 with it's issues fixed.

data.title: RA - Replace Fake CYard with Fake MCV for France
data.body:
I use fake MCVs in my YR mod, not fake CYard.
http://www.moddb.com/mods/red-alert-2-yuris-revenge-cncd2k-mod/images/fake-mcvs#imagebox

It makes sense because if enemy has visibility over your base he can understand Fake CYard is fake because you build it via real CYard, not a MCV. This can fix it. Fake MCV shouldn't require Service Depot as Fake buildings doesn't require anything too.

data.title: Map update: Symmetrification of some popular maps
data.body:
- Rogue States, Manufacturing Consent and Necessary Illusions are now near-perfectly symmetrical. 
  Hopefully this will make them more appealing for tournament play. Their overall form hasn't changed much, but they had some lines redrawn and a general cleanup. Necessary Illusions is now a temperate tileset because people complained the snow tileset hurts their eyes.
- Letters from Lexington was re-added after symmetrification and some minor layout adjustments for playability and fairness, including removal of viceroids due to their new "roaming" behaviour.

Maps included:
Letters from Lexington: http://resource.openra.net/maps/14560/
Necessary Illusions: http://resource.openra.net/maps/11829/
Manufacturing Consent: http://resource.openra.net/maps/11844/
Rogue States: http://resource.openra.net/maps/13588/

Supersedes #11221.

data.title: Railways don't get rendered anymore
data.body:
Download: http://resource.openra.net/maps/12356/

I assume this has something to do with terrain height. The canyon might be above or below ground 0. Also the terrain geometry cursor bugged out highlighting 4 cells instead of 1.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/15990431/5e9cd2fa-3092-11e6-8122-49a67ee13de1.png)

In the map editor the railways are shown.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/15990465/3706f3aa-3093-11e6-803b-9d99f128a47c.png)

data.title: Added static Tiberian Sun low bridges
data.body: A slightly improved and rebased version of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10764 which now imports dead bridges as dead actors that are rendered transparent in the map editor.

data.title: Grouped units move back and forth after reaching their destination
data.body: See the group of flak trucks in the bottom left https://youtu.be/xc6q2C2CtRg?t=1m47s As the destination cell is blocked by friendly units they seem to retry all the time.

data.title: Units told to guard stop guarding after killing one enemy.
data.body: As title, units given the order to guard will stop guarding once they target a unit

data.title: Pressing Restart after a multiplayer match causes the game to lock up
data.body: Starting a game on a multiplayer server with bots and/or yourself gives the option to restart. I imagine this isn't intended because upon pressing restart, the game locks up.

data.title: Pathfinding remembers where units were even after moving
data.body:
eg. If an APC is given an order to move and its path crosses another unit, even if that unit is moved the APC will attempt to avoid running over the tile it occupied at the time of giving the order.

This is the same for all units and technically gives two possible places for units to be which could account for a lot of the pathfinding blockages in chokes.
Replay enclosed
[Pathfinding.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/310409/Pathfinding.zip)
Notice how the MCV moves out of the way of the infantry despite being moved and the same happens for the infantry and the humvee

data.title: Updated NSIS to version 2.51
data.body:
also removed some bit rot since https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8796/commits/03ace480314a4d373db13da45fd65e217e391c68.

Changelog see: http://nsis.sourceforge.net/Docs/AppendixF.html#v2.51 It is mostly security updates. The OpenRA setup is currently exposing a security vulnerability during installation.

data.title: Remove WithSpriteRotorOverlay
data.body: Closes #11427.

data.title: Replace WithVoxelWaterBody with UpgradeOnTerrain.
data.body: Didn't write an upgrade rule because the TS DLL isn't shipped, though.

data.title: Rendered projectile position should be predicted between logic ticks.
data.body:
Fast projectiles look very jumpy, especially on slower game speeds.  We can dramatically improve this by predicting the position we expect a projectile to be in at the next game tick and then smoothly lerping towards that each render frame.  If the guess is wrong, then the visual jump will be no worse than what we have now.

Note: this ticket only covers projectile position prediction, which is a relatively simple and self-contained task.  Predicting actor positions is a much harder problem that should be considered separately.

data.title: Convert TrailInterval to distance instead of time interval
data.body:
TrailInterval is currently very restrictive as even a value of 1 results in a slow spawn rate. Below is an image showing ORA and YR at 25 ticks per second. Nothing like the YR trailer rate is remotely possible right now, and infact the ORA projectile is moving at a slower speed too.

![flamethrower](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8225171/15984870/118b38b4-2fd2-11e6-852f-f5075751d285.png)

pchote's suggestion is to convert TrailInterval to use distance instead of a time interval that would allow much greater customisation and more rapid spawn rates.

data.title: [RA] Rebalance camo pillbox as country specific building
data.body:
Another balance suggestion from the [community](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=296162#296162) that was well received.

Test map available here - http://resource.openra.net/maps/14515/

This PR gives the camo pillbox to France.
- It costs the same as a normal pillbox
- It is available at the same tech level as the normal pillbox
- It has an extra 200hp (same health as current camo PB)
- It has cloaking obviously
- It has been moved in the sidebar so that defense hotkeys are consistent across allied factions

France's early play-style is rather deceptive and defensive due to their fake buildings. Static defences are still a big investment early game (and can be avoided) so I think camo PBs should be fairly strong early game. Currently players can hold fire their camo pillboxes to lure early infantry rushes closer for maximum kill chance. I wanted to build on this with the very under utilized infantry garrison mechanism.

$400 camo PB (with free $100 rifle) + $300 RS = $600 turret + $100 rifle. 

With the cheaper price and lower tech level I hope to see some interesting RS garrison plays (once #11429 is fixed) to counter early LT and APC blocking strats safely. Although camo PBs still have 200hp more than turrets, turrets fire much faster and have better range so they won't be replaced by camo RS pillboxes.

~~The original pillbox for France still exists unchanged as I felt any changes would make them more likely to be spammed. I left it in to give French players more options if your opponent doesn't know you are playing France. A live decoy as it were.~~

data.title: Air units won't close the distance to attack other air units if ground weapon range is different
data.body:
As was mentioned by @HenrytheSlav in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11337#issuecomment-221490963 

> it was found that if longbow has two weapons with different ranges, f.e. AA 5 cells and ground 6 cells, then it will fail to shoot/move closer when at 6 cells distance against aircraft because it tries to use wrong weapon.

On bleed

data.title: Garrisoned rocket soldiers damage own building
data.body:
Placing a rocket soldier in a pillbox in the RA mod and alternating fire either side of the pill box will cause the rockets to hit and damage the pillbox or at best cause massive turn arcs.

On bleed.

data.title: Allow attack anims/overlays to start before weapons fire
data.body:
This allows attack animations/overlays to ignore `Armament.FireDelay` and start right away, which in turn allows fixing Grenadier throw anim timing.

Closes #11331.

data.title: Get rid of WithSpriteRotorOverlay
data.body: As mentioned in #9910, this trait is actually redundant now, because it's functionality can be completely replicated with `WithIdleOverlay` + aircraft upgrades.

data.title: Support dynamic ActorPreview facings and creating previews from live actors.
data.body: This is a revamped version of #10824 with some additional fixes.  The TD hovercraft has been changed to use ActorPreviews as a demonstration.  I have also pushed an updated version of @teees's `tibsun-carryall` branch that can be used as a further testcase.

data.title: Veterancy on Heavy Armour makes them invincible to riflemen
data.body:
Found this bug in RA and TD
Heavy Armour vehicles receive no damage from rifleman

http://logs.openra.net/index.php?year=2016&month=06&day=10#16:08:39

data.title: Add a maximum limit to InfiltrateForCash.
data.body:
**This does not affect the default mods.**

My reason behind this would be "because Ares (http://ares-developers.github.io/Ares-docs/new/buildings/spybehavior.html#money)" and because modders might not want to allow spies to have a chance of granting more than, say ten times the spy's own value even from an unlucky hoarder as a balance choice.

data.title: Expose TeslaZap duration to yaml.
Fixed the AppVeyor build
data.body:
Looks like the https://chocolatey.org/packages/pandoc changed towards a more sane install.

```
pandoc has been installed.
pandoc installed to 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Pandoc'
Adding pandoc to the PATH if needed
```

Adjusting our build scripts to fix the systematically failing builds.
